name: The European Alliance of Companies for Energy Efficiency in Buildings
goal: The mission of EuroACE is to work together with the European institutions to help the EU move towards a more efficient use of energy in buildings, thereby contributing to European goals on job creation, economic growth, energy security and fighting climate change.
interests: Budget, Business and Industry, Climate Action, Energy, Environment, Regional Policy, Research and innovation
euInitiatives: EuroACE represents the interests of its members vis-à-vis EU energy efficiency policy. The main priority of EuroACE is currently the EU Green Deal, the EU Climate and Energy Framework for 2030, the Energy Efficiency Directive, the Governance Regulation, the Energy Performance of Buildings Directive, the 2050 EU Climate Neutral Strategy, and the MFF post 2020, as well as financing schemes relevant for energy renovation of buildings.
